turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for some new games to play. I'm really into strategy games, especially real-time strategy. Any recommendations?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! For real-time strategy games, I would recommend checking out *StarCraft II*, *Company of Heroes*, or *Age of Empires IV*. These are all highly rated and offer engaging gameplay. Does any of those sound interesting?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, I've played StarCraft II to death. Age of Empires IV was alright, but not quite my thing. Company of Heroes sounds interesting though, tell me more about that one.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: *Company of Heroes* is a World War II-based RTS known for its tactical depth and focus on squad-based combat. It emphasizes cover, flanking, and resource management. There's also a sequel, *Company of Heroes 2*, set on the Eastern Front, if you prefer a different setting. The original game also has a thriving modding community.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that sounds pretty cool. But what if I wanted something a little more... niche? Like, are there any good indie RTS games with a unique theme or mechanic? Something that isn't just another historical war game.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Let me see...an indie RTS with a unique theme... Hmm. *They Are Billions* is a steampunk strategy game where you build and defend a base against massive zombie hordes. Or, *Northgard* is based on Norse mythology, where you control a Viking clan vying for control of a mysterious continent.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Awesome! Northgard sounds exactly like what I was looking for. Thanks for the help!
